titles.title: Parimutuel Licensing Simplification Act of 1988
Parimutuel Licensing Simplification Act of 1988
Parimutuel Licensing Simplification Act of 1988
Parimutuel Licensing Simplification Act of 1988

A bill to simplify the process of obtaining licensing by States for participation in parimutuel wagering by allowing consolidated requests to be made to the Federal Government for identification and criminal history records relating to the applicant for such licensing.

action.text: Referred to House Committee on The Judiciary.
Referred to Subcommittee on Civil and Constitutional Rights.
Subcommittee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Forwarded by Subcommittee to Full Committee (Amended).
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Reported to House (Amended) by House Committee on The Judiciary. Report No: 100-832.
Called up by House Under Suspension of Rules.
Received in the Senate, read twice.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Voice Vote.

bill.summary: 8/8/1988--Passed House amended. (Measure passed House, amended) Parimutuel Licensing Simplification Act of 1988 - Allows any association of State officials regulating parimutuel wagering, for licensing and employment purposes, to submit fingerprints to the Attorney General for identification and criminal history records checks.
